Wow this drug is horrible. They prescribed it to me before the tooth extraction and told me it's like morphine. Little did I know it's a NSAID with blood thinning properties. The exact opposite of something you'd want before/after a tooth extraction. NSAIDs immensely slow down the healing process since inflammation is important for healing. And the blood thinning properties of Ketorolac (Toradol) make it impossible to stop bleeding. Whose bright idea was it to prescribe a blood thinner and anti-inflammatory for a tooth extraction? People are so afraid of opioids these days (tried and true) and its absolutely ridiculous. I've never had any issue with opioid addiction or withdrawals even though I've taken hydromorphone, morphine, tramadol, percocet and oxycodone before in my life for pain. Now it's like every doctor thinks opioids are the devil and they refuse to prescribe them for pain. NSAID isn't good for pain and prolongs the healing process. Doctors are absolutely ridiculous these days.

Toradol (ketorolac):I had a deep cavity filled and the dentist warned I might need a root canal but we'd wait and see. He prescribed Ketorlac (Toradol) in case I had pain. Oh boy I had pain. I tried Tylenol, nope. Took a Toradol as prescribed and watched the clock. After exactly 30 minutes the pain disappeared. Literally one minute in pain, next minute gone. I felt normal again. It was wonderful. I was careful to take it with food and I also took antacids to be safe. I only took when needed as directed, and just for a few days until the root canal.  Coincidentally developed a migraine during this week and tried a Toradol to see if it would knock it away. Nope, no luck with that. Oh well.
When I need pain management I can only take ketorolac and I don't know how I could handle pain without it
When I need some type of pain management in a urgent situation I can only use ketorolac and I'm so grateful for this medication.

Toradol (ketorolac):I was suffering chronic neck pain caused by working at a computer at home from sunup to sundown. It became acute and hurt so bad that I had to put my hand behind my head to lower myself into bed, and once my head was on the pillow I couldn't move my head in the slightest without intolerable pain. Rolling onto one side was an indescribable ordeal, having to support my head with my hand behind my neck and making incremental moves until finally repositioned. Yesterday afternoon the doctor gave me a shot in the hip of toradol and last night in bed I was totally pain-free. Toradol in a non-steriod anti- inflammatory drug. It works by stopping inflammation, which in turn reduces swelling. When there is swelling, soft tissues in cramped spaces bind together and hurt. If the pain is caused by something other than inflammation, an anti-inflammatory drug is not likely to help. If it doesn't work for you, it doesn't mean it won't work for the next person. It depends on the ailment.

In ER when treated with injectable ketorolac vs just imitrex alone- relief was FAR better. When suffering intractable pain, your brain leads blood supply away from stomach to more "survival mode" organs. Thus, taking a tablet in the midst of level 9 or 10 pain.. won't do much for you for a while. Not only have I had migraines since the 90's, I was diagnosed w/a life long neuralgia @ midlife. This cranial pain comes in 3 versions always on 1 side of body with an average age of onset 50-55 (Can develop 1, both or all 3): Geniculate Neuralgia aka GN (inner/outer ear/jaw/teeth/oral cavity/sinus'), Glossopharygeal Neuralgia aka GPN (throat/voice box ..often tied to GN), or Trigeminal Neuralgia aka TN (face pain). This disorder is also known as a "suicide disease" as >50% of those unable to be helped by neurosurgery ultimately decide "enough". There is nothing MORE painful. I have GN/GPN.

Regular people don't use descriptors like "wonder drug"... PR/marketing people do.  It is also virtually impossible for there to be such disparate reactions to this medication that half say it is ineffective as in it has next to no effect and half reporting "miracle cure" type results. One person's snake oil is not another person's holy water.
